outputs.name: Mark as Normal / Satisfactory
outputs.description: Tests have normalised or notably improved; mark as normal/satisfactory

outputs.name: Code as normal USS and file
outputs.description: Findings present for <3 months and ALT normal; code as normal USS and file

outputs.name: Requires MRCP via Gastroenterology
outputs.description: Patient has Ulcerative Colitis or P-ANCA positive; requires MRCP via Gastroenterology

outputs.name: manage risk factors and co-morbidities - Annual Screening
outputs.description: NAFLD Fibrosis Score F0-F2 (no to moderate fibrosis); manage risk factors and annual screening

outputs.name: No Concern, or escalation required
outputs.description: No further concern or escalation required after telephone consultation

outputs.name: Refer to Secondary Care once bloods are back, irrespective of diagnosis or if all tests normal

start.label: Liver Pathology Suspected & Work up Initiated

Refer to Secondary Care once bloods are back, irrespective of diagnosis or if all tests normal
Need to rationalise which Additional tests should be done for rare conditions

FIB-4 >=1.3 to <2.67 (or >=2.0 if age >=65) - Intermediate or High Risk?
NAFLD Fibrosis Score >0.675 (F3-F4 Severe fibrosis or Cirrhosis)?
Refer to Secondary Care once bloods are back, irrespective of diagnosis or if all tests normal
Autoimmune Hepatitis Type 1 Screen: ANA, SMA; Autoimmune Hepatitis Type 2 Screen: LKM-1, SLA (not on EMIS)
No Raised IgM - proceed to review
Recheck Baseline Liver Profile in appropriate timeframe
Repeat test meets 3 month criteria (from when concern was first identified)?
Code as normal USS and file

doubts: The diagram has several feedback loops (e.g., Telephone Consultation feeding back into Phase 4 Bloods, and Recheck looping back to Phase 3). These cycles cannot be represented in a strict tree; they have been approximated with terminal action nodes.

The 'Review Result' node appears to be shared by multiple branches (after Haemochromatosis, PBC Screen, Autoimmune Screen). In the tree, it is placed after PBC Screen only; other branches terminate without it.

FIB-4 age-adjusted thresholds (<2.0 if age >=65 instead of <1.3) and (>=2.0 if age >=65 for intermediate) are noted in the diagram but complex age-conditional logic is only partially captured in conditions.
The 'Fibrous Scan if available' node appears twice in different branches (Indeterminate NAFLD and Intermediate/High FIB-4). These are represented as separate nodes.
The exact flow between Conditional Testing sub-branches (NAFLD Score vs FIB-4 vs UC/PANCA vs IgG) is not fully clear from the diagram—they may be parallel rather than sequential.
The 'Phase 4 Bloods' box appears multiple times in the diagram (as a central hub and also in the F3-F4 branch). It is unclear if these are the same node or separate actions.
The path from 'No Concern, or escalation required' back from Telephone Consultation when referral is not required is assumed to be the terminal state.
